result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Casey Lee Pengra

defendant.name: Pengra, Casey Lee
defendant.address: 523 S Wasson Ln # 12, River Falls, WI 54022

records.addlTxt:
11:01 AM Casey Lee Pengra appears in Court,  ADA Kaley Walker for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF172 and 22CF200 (STC). DE states he has now lost his job and will need to give that information to the PD's Office. Court will set another STC 30 days out. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 11:05 am.
Status conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Status conference on November 29, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

2:47 PM Defendant Casey Lee Pengra appears in Court, DA Halle E. Hatch for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF172 and 22CF200 (STC). DE plans to retain counsel, he is working with the PD's Office at this time. DE will also pick up a PFAC. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 2:54 pm.
Status conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on October 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.
from Ct Comm Gavic to Casey Pengra's letter "Defendant must appear to waive time requirements."
from Casey Pengra requesting to a continuation of his court on September 26, 2022, he has lost his job and does not qualify for a PD and needs more time to secure legal help.

Maintain Absolute Sobriety. 
Not to enter any bars, taverns or liquor stores where alcohol is the primary sales/service. 
Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. 
NO CONTACT WITH OFFICER PATRICK MCGINTY EXCEPT IN AN OFFICIAL CAPACITY.
Court finds DE freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to those time requirements.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
3:17 PM Defendant Casey Lee Pengra appears in custody from Jail via zoom, Atty Travis Satorius, DA Halle E. Hatch for the State of Wisconsin. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. DE does not qualify for PD. DA Hatch is requesting a $10,000.00 signature bond w/conditions of absolute sobriety, Not to enter any bars, taverns or liquor stores where alcohol is the primary sales/service, Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  & no contact w/Officer Patrick McGinty unless in official capacity, no objection. Court so orders. Waive the time limits. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:27 pm.
Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Status conference on September 26, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
